alert.note: Alert for Burleigh; Emmons; Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 7:51PM CDT until August 23 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Burleigh County in south central North Dakota... Eastern Morton County in south central North Dakota... Northwestern Emmons County in south central North Dakota... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 750 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two inches of rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bismarck, Mandan, Lincoln, Menoken, St. Anthony, Mcdowell Dam Recreation Area, Fort Abraham Lincoln State Park, University Of Mary and Huff. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.
